diseases.remedy: Papyrus ash applied to wound to stop bleeding; clean water wash
diseases.method: Burn papyrus straw to ashes; apply a thin layer to wound after washing to help clotting
diseases.dose: Thin layer; reapply until bleeding controlled
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — Uhud wound account (Fatimah & ‘Ali)
diseases.remedy_description: Papyrus is a tall green reed with triangular stems; when burned it produces fine ash historically used for wound treatment. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Cyperus_papyrus

diseases.remedy: Narcissus flower cooked with bitter vetch and honey (topical)
diseases.method: Cook narcissus with bitter vetch (karsana) and honey; apply paste to lesion until it ripens and drains
diseases.dose: Topical application once daily until drainage
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — Narcissus entry (treatment of pimples and boils)
diseases.remedy_description: Narcissus is a bulbous flower with white petals and a central yellow trumpet; fragrant and used both ornamentally and medicinally. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Narcissus

diseases.remedy: Raw natural honey applied to hair/scalp
diseases.method: Spread honey over hair and scalp as ointment, leave short duration, rinse
diseases.dose: Apply thoroughly; frequency 1–2 times weekly until cleared
diseases.source: Natural Healing with the Medicine of the Prophet — Benefits of Honey
diseases.remedy_description: Raw honey applied to hair is sticky and viscous, appearing amber-gold; used as a natural conditioner and for lice removal. More images: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Honey
